attributes.title: Lifeline Cheese
attributes.description:
Created on November 15, 2010 by JField on Sourcemap.org:

Lifeline Farm Inc. was founded in 1978 and all Lifeline cheese is made in Victor, MT.  

Lifeline cheese is primarily distributed in Montana, Idaho, Oregon, Washington and the Dakotas.  It is available anywhere within a 3-day shipping radius.

attributes.name: Lifeline Cheese
attributes.title: Lifeline Cheese
attributes.description:
Lifeline Farm Inc. was founded in 1978 and all Lifeline cheese is made in Victor, MT.  

Lifeline cheese is primarily distributed in Montana, Idaho, Oregon, Washington and the Dakotas.  It is available anywhere within a 3-day shipping radius.

attributes.name: Milk
attributes.title: Milk
attributes.description: Local milk from Victor.  Cow's milk is the primary component in most cheeses.  In colby jack cheese, both the colby(orange) and jack(white) are made from cow's milk.

attributes.name: Rennet
attributes.title: Rennet
attributes.description: Rennet from Dairy Connection. Rennet contains enzymes that cause milk to become curds(solids) and whey(liquid).  The whey is then drained off, leaving only the curd as edible cheese.

attributes.name: Salt
attributes.title: Salt
attributes.description:
Salt from Cargill.*  Salt is an important part of the cheese making process, as salt can be added to curing cheeses to prevent them from spoiling. 

*While Cargill headquarters is in Monticello, Cargill has several shipping locations and the salt used in Lifeline cheeses may be from one of several places.

attributes.name: Cheese cultures
attributes.title: Cheese cultures
attributes.description: Cultures from Danisco.  Cheese cultures are benign bacteria that, along with rennet, allow milk to become cheese.  There are two types of cultures: Mesophilic, for soft cheeses and those heated at low temperatures, and Thermophilic, for cheeses that are cooked during their creation.

attributes.name: Plastic packaging
attributes.title: Plastic packaging
attributes.description: Packaging from Dahl Wholesale.  Packaging allows cheese to be protected from the environment on its way to stores and consumers.
